ovdesc.p: This application is used to define files from which records are to be extracted for external processing either when they are updated online or by the periodic extract which extracts all records in the file(s).

A prime example of this is for OFAC (USA Office of Foreign Assets Control) checking for name organisations or individuals subject to sanctions. The data extracted is subject to text scans by other computer systems looking for matches against official lists and producing reports of any matches found.
The extracted data is stored in the UNIVERSE file F.EB.EXTRACT (Type 19) which is equivalent to a Unix directory.
An associated ENQUIRY, EB.EXTRACT.VIEW can be used to examine the extracted records.
For online transactions it is possible for data to be stored from several files in the same extract record, data generated from each file update will be stored on a separate line.
All extracted file records will in addition have all I-descriptor and J fields processed and added to the extracted file record data.

It is possible by defining Joins and I-descriptors in the STANDARD.SELECTION application for the defined extract files to obtain data from related files which will be added to the extracted file record.
A typical example would be to add customer names and adresses for all customer numbers entered into a FUNDS TRANSFER record.
This is set up in the following way:
The customer record on STANDARD.SELECTION is amended to include an I-descriptor field for NAME.ADDRESS which concatenates the name and address information separated by spaces, e.g.
USR.FIELD.NAME. NAME.ADDRESS USR.TYPE....... I USR.FIELD.NO SHORT.NAME:' ':NAME.1:' ':NAME.2:' ':STREET:' ' USR.FIELD.NO :TOWN.COUNTRY
The FUNDS.TRANSFER record is modified to add join fields for customer name and address information for all the customer number fields (the same approach can be used for account numbers).
USR.FIELD.NAME. ORD.CUST.NAME USR.TYPE....... J USR.FIELD.NO ORDERING.CUST>CUSTOMER>NAME.ADDRESS
When the funds transfer record is extracted the name and address of the ordering customer will be added to the funds transfer data record.

EXTRACT.RTN

A local routine to process and write transactional records to a centralized file for all companies can be attached here. This is a user exit field and if a routine is attached in this field, this routine will be called instead of EB.EXTRACT.ONLINE to extract the records.

A local routine can be specified for each FILE.NAME. This user exit is available only for ONLINE record. Even if journaling is switched off, the local routine is called. The routine must have two arguments, txn id and the txn record (R.JOURNAL)
If local routine is to be attached it should be specified for every FILE.NAME in the record.
The routine name must be prefixed with an @ symbol
The routine must have a record in PGM.FILE with PGM.TYPE set to 'S' and APPL.FOR.SUBR set to EB.EXTRACT.PARAMETER
There are two records allowed for this application:
ONLINE identifies files for which records are to be extracted when updates occur online.
PERIODIC identifies files for which all records are to be extracted (from the live file only).
It is envisaged that the files defined in the periodic record will be processed during the T24 batch on an ad hoc basis.
N.B. It is possible to perform the periodic extraction online by changing the PGM.FILE record EB.EXTRACT.PERIODIC, TYPE field to M.
Must be either ONLINE or PERIODIC.
This field is reserved for future expansion.
This is a NOINPUT field.
Identifies for ONLINE updates the type of file (identified in FILE.NAME) for which record updates are to be extracted.
There are three types of T24 file from which records can be extracted, unauthorised, authorised and history.
NAU indicates that extracts are required from the Unauthorised file.
HIS indicates that extracts are required from the History file
LVE indicates that extracts are required from the Live file
If no input is entered then the default will be the Live file.
Input is not allowed for the PERIODIC record.
For the purpose of OFAC extracts the unauthorised file would normally be defined so that checking can be made before authorisation takes place.
Multi valued field of 3 characters.
Input is only allowed for the ONLINE record.
